history.proof: intros E1 E2 H. unfold EQ. shelve.

exceptions.exn: In environment E1, E2 : Ens' H : EQ' E1 E2 Unable to unify "EQ' E1 E2" with "Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Ens -> Prop) (fun (A : Type) (_ : A -> Ens) (eq1 : A -> Ens -> Prop) (X0 : Ens) => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Prop) (fun (B : Type) (g : B -> Ens) (_ : B -> Prop) => (forall x : A, EXType B (fun y : B => eq1 x (g y))) /\\ (forall y : B, EXType A (fun x : A => eq1 x (g y)))) X0) (inj E1) (inj E2)".

In environment E1, E2 : Ens' H : EQ' E1 E2 Unable to unify "EQ' E1 E2" with "Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Ens -> Prop) (fun (A : Type) (_ : A -> Ens) (eq1 : A -> Ens -> Prop) (X0 : Ens) => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Prop) (fun (B : Type) (g : B -> Ens) (_ : B -> Prop) => (forall x : A, EXType B (fun y : B => eq1 x (g y))) /\\ (forall y : B, EXType A (fun x : A => eq1 x (g y)))) X0) (inj E1) (inj E2)".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall E1 E2 : Ens', EQ' E1 E2 -> EQ (inj E1) (inj E2)

Premises:
inj = fun X : Ens' => Ens'_rect (fun _ : Ens' => Ens) (fun (A : Type) (_ : A -> Ens') (fr : A -> Ens) => sup A fr) X : Ens' -> Ens
EQ = fun X : Ens => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Ens -> Prop) (fun (A : Type) (_ : A -> Ens) (eq1 : A -> Ens -> Prop) (X0 : Ens) => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Prop) (fun (B : Type) (g : B -> Ens) (_ : B -> Prop) => (forall x : A, EXType B (fun y : B => eq1 x (g y))) /\ (forall y : B, EXType A (fun x : A => eq1 x (g y)))) X0) X : Ens -> Ens -> Prop
Inductive Ens : Type := sup : forall A : Type, (A -> Ens) -> Ens Arguments sup _%type_scope _%function_scope
EQ_Sing_EQ : forall E1 E2 : Ens, EQ (Sing E1) (Sing E2) -> EQ E1 E2
EQ_sym : forall E1 E2 : Ens, EQ E1 E2 -> EQ E2 E1
EQ_tran : forall E1 E2 E3 : Ens, EQ E1 E2 -> EQ E2 E3 -> EQ E1 E3
INC = fun E1 E2 : Ens => forall E : Ens, IN E E1 -> IN E E2 : Ens -> Ens -> Prop
IN = fun E1 E2 : Ens => match E2 with | sup A f => EXType A (fun y : A => EQ E1 (f y)) end : Ens -> Ens -> Prop
Ens'_rect : forall P : Ens' -> Type, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens'), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup' A e)) -> forall e : Ens', P e
Ens'_sind : forall P : Ens' -> SProp, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens'), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup' A e)) -> forall e : Ens', P e
Ens'_ind : forall P : Ens' -> Prop, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens'), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup' A e)) -> forall e : Ens', P e
Ens'_rec : forall P : Ens' -> Set, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens'), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup' A e)) -> forall e : Ens', P e
Power_sound : forall E E' : Ens, EQ E E' -> EQ (Power E) (Power E')
Union_sound : forall E E' : Ens, EQ E E' -> EQ (Union E) (Union E')
Sing_sound : forall A A' : Ens, EQ A A' -> EQ (Sing A) (Sing A')
Paire_sound_left : forall A A' B : Ens, EQ A A' -> EQ (Paire A B) (Paire A' B)
Paire_sound_right : forall A B B' : Ens, EQ B B' -> EQ (Paire A B) (Paire A B')
not_EQ_Vide_Sing : forall E : Ens, EQ Vide (Sing E) -> F
not_EQ_Sing_Vide : forall E : Ens, EQ (Sing E) Vide -> F
tout_vide_est_Vide : forall E : Ens, (forall E' : Ens, IN E' E -> F) -> EQ E Vide
EQ_EXType : forall E E' : Ens, EQ E E' -> forall a : pi1 E, EXType (pi1 E') (fun b : pi1 E' => EQ (pi2 E a) (pi2 E' b))
Paire_IN : forall E E' A : Ens, IN A (Paire E E') -> EQ A E \/ EQ A E'
INC_EQ : forall E E' : Ens, INC E E' -> INC E' E -> EQ E E'
EQ_INC : forall E E' : Ens, EQ E E' -> INC E E'
INC_sound_left : forall E E' E'' : Ens, EQ E E' -> INC E E'' -> INC E' E''
IN_sound_right : forall E E' E'' : Ens, EQ E' E'' -> IN E E' -> IN E E''
IN_sound_left : forall E E' E'' : Ens, EQ E E' -> IN E E'' -> IN E' E''
INC_sound_right : forall E E' E'' : Ens, EQ E' E'' -> INC E E' -> INC E E''
IN_Sing_EQ : forall E E' : Ens, IN E (Sing E') -> EQ E E'
EQ' = fun X : Ens' => Ens'_rect (fun _ : Ens' => Ens' -> Prop) (fun (A : Type) (_ : A -> Ens') (eq1 : A -> Ens' -> Prop) (X0 : Ens') => Ens'_rect (fun _ : Ens' => Prop) (fun (B : Type) (g : B -> Ens') (_ : B -> Prop) => (forall x : A, EXType' B (fun y : B => eq1 x (g y))) /\ (forall y : B, EXType' A (fun x : A => eq1 x (g y)))) X0) X : Ens' -> Ens' -> Prop
IN_Comp_P : forall (E A : Ens) (P : Ens -> Prop), (forall w1 w2 : Ens, P w1 -> EQ w1 w2 -> P w2) -> IN A (Comp E P) -> P A
IN_P_Comp : forall (E A : Ens) (P : Ens -> Prop), (forall w1 w2 : Ens, P w1 -> EQ w1 w2 -> P w2) -> IN A E -> P A -> IN A (Comp E P)
IN_EXType : forall E E' : Ens, IN E' E -> EXType (pi1 E) (fun a : pi1 E => EQ E' (pi2 E a))
EQ_refl : forall E : Ens, EQ E E
BinNat.N.peano_rec : forall P : BinNums.N -> Set, P BinNums.N0 -> (forall n : BinNums.N, P n -> P (BinNat.N.succ n)) -> forall n : BinNums.N, P n
ssrbool.prop_in11 : forall T1 T2 : Type, ssrbool.mem_pred T1 -> ssrbool.mem_pred T2 -> forall P : T1 -> T2 -> Prop, ssreflect.phantom Prop (forall (x : T1) (y : T2), P x y) -> Prop
ssrbool.prop_in2 : forall T1 : Type, ssrbool.mem_pred T1 -> forall P : T1 -> T1 -> Prop, ssreflect.phantom Prop (forall x y : T1, P x y) -> Prop
InitialRing.Ntriv_div_th : forall (R : Type) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Setoid.Setoid_Theory R req -> forall nphi : BinNums.N -> R, Ring_theory.div_theory req BinNat.N.add BinNat.N.mul nphi BinNat.N.div_eucl
Ring_polynom.PEeval : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> R
ssrbool.prop_on1 : forall T1 T2 T3 : Type, ssrbool.mem_pred T2 -> forall (f : T1 -> T2) (Pf : (T1 -> T2) -> T3) (P : T1 -> Prop), ssreflect.phantom T3 (Pf f) -> ssreflect.phantom Prop (forall x : T1, P x) -> Prop
Ens_rect : forall P : Ens -> Type, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup A e)) -> forall e : Ens, P e
Ens_ind : forall P : Ens -> Prop, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup A e)) -> forall e : Ens, P e
Ring_polynom.interp_PElist : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> Prop

``` 
intros E1 E2 H.
unfold EQ.
simpl.
intro x.
split.
- intro y.
apply H.
- intro y.
apply H.
```

original: intros E1 E2 H. unfold EQ. simpl. intro x. split. - intro y. apply H. - intro y. apply H.
